Sentencas: Various perovskite-type materials have been developed and applied in the field of solid oxide fuel cells (SOFCs).
Titulo: Preparation of SOFC Anodes at Lower Temperature with Boosted Electrochemical Performance

Sentencas: The perovskite oxides prepared by the traditional solid-state method usually need to be calcined at a temperature higher than 1000 degrees
Titulo: Preparation of SOFC Anodes at Lower Temperature with Boosted Electrochemical Performance

Sentencas: C. Herein, a modified solvothermal synthesis is proposed to prepare the La0.43Ca0.37Ti0.94Ni0.06O3-,5 (LCTNi) anode at 800 degrees C.
Titulo: Preparation of SOFC Anodes at Lower Temperature with Boosted Electrochemical Performance

Sentencas: Compared to the material with identical composition synthesized by the solid-state method (denoted as LCTNi-ss), LCTNi synthesized at the lower temperature possesses smaller particle size, greater specific surface area, higher total conductivity, and better interfacial contact with the electrolyte.
Titulo: Preparation of SOFC Anodes at Lower Temperature with Boosted Electrochemical Performance

Sentencas: The single cell assembled with the LCTNi anode exhibits desirable electrochemical performance using wet H2 as fuel.
Titulo: Preparation of SOFC Anodes at Lower Temperature with Boosted Electrochemical Performance

Sentencas: The maximum power density is as high as similar to 425 mW cm-2 at 800 degrees C in 3% H2O/97% H2 (similar to 2.5 times higher than that of the LCTNi-ss anode single cell).
Titulo: Preparation of SOFC Anodes at Lower Temperature with Boosted Electrochemical Performance

Sentencas: The boosted performance is mainly attributed to the facilitated gas diffusion process at the LCTNi anode side.
Titulo: Preparation of SOFC Anodes at Lower Temperature with Boosted Electrochemical Performance
